title: "What is the esoteric teaching of interiority in 'Pietro Negri sub Specie Interioritatis'?"
first_phrase: In the previous section, the author described his experience of suddenly perceiving the immaterial reality. Now, in the last 200 tokens, he explains the significance of this experience for those who are seeking enlightenment. He refers to the initiation teachings which guide the serious and committed seekers, suggesting that they will not be alone on their path. The author then includes two quotes from Giubertus and M. Mayer, which imply that spiritual growth is a personal journey that requires mastery of the physical realm. The author, Pietro Negri, then goes on to recount his experience of becoming aware of the spiritual realm, which has remained vivid in his memory for over 14 years.
content: Ma, nonostante il fluire del tempo, l’impressione che ne provai fu così vivida, così possente, da permanere tuttora nella memoria, per quanto sia possibile trasfondere e ritenere in essa certe esperienze trascendenti; ed io tenterò, oggi, di esprimere, humanis verbis, questa impressione, rievocandola dagli intimi recessi della coscienza. Il senso della realtà immateriale mi balenò nella coscienza all’improvviso, senza antefatti, senza alcuna apparente causa o ragione determinante. Circa quattordici anni fa stavo un giorno, fermo ed in piedi, sul marciapiede del palazzo Strozzi a Firenze, discorrendo con un amico; non ricordo di che ci intrattenessimo, ma probabilmente di qualche argomento concernente l’esoterismo; cosa del resto senza importanza per l’esperienza che ebbi. Era una giornata affatto simile alle altre, ed io mi trovavo in perfetta salute di corpo e di spirito, non stanco, non eccitato, non ebbro, libero da preoccupazioni ed assilli.
last_phrase: In conclusion, the experience of perceiving the immaterial reality was a sudden and transcendent moment that stayed vividly impressed in the memory of the author, even after the passing of time. This event brought a new and different perspective to the way everything was perceived and made the author realize that the center of everything is within oneself. It's an example of how unexpected moments of realization can have a profound impact on our consciousness and understanding of the world.
